```{r convertToMagrittr, results='hide'}
x <- lapply(dir(R.home("library")), packageDescription)
str(x[[1]])
structure(sapply(x, "[[", "Maintainer"), names = sapply(x, "[[", "Package"))
```

```{r}
library(magrittr)
"library" %>% R.home %>% dir %>% 
  lapply(., FUN = packageDescription) %>% 
  lapply(., FUN = "[", c("Package", "Maintainer")) -> 
  x
 
x %>% (function(xx = .) { structure(xx[2], names = xx[1])})
```
```{r needABetterSoln}
structure(sapply(x, "[[", "Maintainer"), names = sapply(x, "[[", "Package"))

```

The API is pretty simple
```{r API}
x = rnorm(20)
library(sparkline)
sparkline(x)
sparkline(x, type = 'bar')
sparkline(x, type = 'box')
```
`r sparkline(x, type = 'bar')` goes here.
